awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award:  Research in Experi- mental Elementary Particle Physics
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports research in elementary particle                        physics by Dr. Gregory R. Snow, a Presidential Young                            Investigator.  Dr. Snow is working on UA-6, an experiment at                    CERN in Geneva, Switzerland.                                                         This experiment is a study of "direct photons" produced in                 high energy collisions of protons.  These are photons (light                    quanta) emitted directly from some of the constituents of the                   proton, during the collision.  Their detection and study will                   provide information on the way the constituents are held                        together in protons and other subnuclear particles.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
